title: British terror attack risk reaches 'new-high' says London Mayor
text:
GETTY AT RISK: Sadiq Khan worried for safety of London 
Mr Khan revealed budget cuts to policing had seen a rise in the risk of terror atrocities happening in the capital. 
He added Donald Trump's stance on Muslims would only increase the chance of young Brits being radicalised through ISIS propaganda. 
Capital cities like Berlin, where a truck was ploughed into a busy Christmas market, and Paris, where gunman descended on an Eagles of Death Metal concert, have been rocked by recent terror assaults. 
GETTY TARGET: Mr Khan admitted London would be on Jihadi's attack list “I think keeping London safe is becoming increasingly difficult” Sadiq Khan 
Only a few days ago, a knifeman stormed the Louvre museum screaming "Allahu Akhbar" . 
And Mr Khan admitted that London would be a target for Jihadis due to its global status. 
He told Mail Online: "The reality is that if you look at other global cities, berlin, Istanbul most recently, but Paris and other past of the world. Our global cities are target for terrorists. Berlin pays tribute to those dead in the Christmas market terror attack Tuesday, 20th December 2016 Berlin pays tribute to those who were affected by the terror attack at a Christmas market 1 / 9 Getty Images German Chancellor Angela Merkel arrives to lay flowers near where yesterday a lorry ploughed through a Christmas market on December 20, 2016 in Berlin, Germany 
"If the government changes the police funding formula and if they fail to fund London as a capital city… I think keeping London safe is becoming increasingly difficult." 
ISIS is believed to have terror cells lying in wait in the UK , ready to deliver atrocities on the scale of those in Paris and Berlin. 
Addressing the despicable terrorists, Mr Khan said the ISIS threat in Britain had "without a doubt" increased in the last year. 
He said: "The bad guys want to harm us. They hate the fact we live together. 
"We can't escape the fax that ISIS are now using the internet to radicalise Brits." 
He added: "The best way it has been explained to me is that the bad guys are evolving. Related articles
